content: perfectly pretty facecloth or baby washcloth close up of stitch i used patons bumblebee baby cotton in petunia i know it s discontinued but i purchased it off of ebay-you could use sugar n cream sportsweight or any sportsweight 100% cotton or 100% baby cotton or use regular worsted cotton and an h hook or i whichever you prefer -the cloth will just be slightly bigger stitches used chain single_crochet and double_crochet-this is a variation of a sedge stitch materials patons bumblebee cotton-50 gram skein/123 yards-i used 1/2 a skein for this so 1 skein makes two cloths-see above for substitutions size f crochet hook 4 mm tapestry needle for weaving in ends finished size is 6 1/2 x 6 1/2 instructions chain 32 row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across-chain 1 counts as single_crochet for next row and turn row 2 double_crochet in first single_crochet same stitch as chain 1 from previous row *skip 1 single_crochet single_crochet and double_crochet both in same stitch in next st* repeat across and end with 1 single_crochet in last single_crochet chain 1 and turn row 3-22 double_crochet in first single_crochet same stitch as chain 1 from previous row *skip next double_crochet single_crochet and double_crochet both in same stitch in next single_crochet* repeat across and end with single_crochet in turning chain chain 1 turn keep repeating until it measures approx 6 1/4 from start or near a perfect square and then do last row-depending on how you crochet you may end up doing 23 row or more- 6 1/4 from start is the key last row single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across ending with 2 single_crochet in last st fasten_off and weave in ends the single_crochet row at the beginning and end works as a nice
